name: Never truncate data in MOVE statements
description:
This rule searches for Cobol programs containing MOVE statements where data are truncated.

Data assignments are checked for MOVE and MOVE CORRESPONDING statements. 

Decimal part of numeric variables is not taken into account and these variables are considered like variables not having decimal part. 
The rule will not detect violations related to decimal part and violations related to position:length accesses (in source variables and in target variables).
output:
Associated to each COBOL Program with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The number of violation patterns
- Bookmarks for violation patterns found in source code:
  - MOVE statement
  - Source variable
  - Target variable
rationale: If a variable or a group is moved into another that is shorter, then it will be truncated and part of the information will be lost. This is going to generate troubles in production. In addition, data defined after the target data could be overridden and an abend can occur.
remediation: If a target data is shorter than the source data in a MOVE statement, then either enlarge the size of the target data or move part of the source data only.
remediationSample:
* Exemple 1
 01 A PIC X(10).
 01 B PIC X(10).
. . .
 MOVE A TO B
* or
 01 A.
     05 A1 PIC X(5).
     05 A2 PIC X(5).
 01 B PIC X(5).
. . .
 MOVE A1 TO B

* Exemple 2
 01 A.
     05 A1 PIC X(5).
     05 A2 PIC 999.
     05 A3 PIC X(2).
 01 B PIC X(10).
. . .
 MOVE A TO B
* or
 01 A.
     05 A-PART1.
         10 A1 PIC X(5).
         10 A2 PIC 999.
     05 A3 PIC X(2).
 01 B PIC X(8).
. . .
 MOVE A-PART1 TO B
sample:
* Exemple 1
 01 A PIC X(10).
 01 B PIC X(5).
. . .
 MOVE A TO B

* Exemple 2
 01 A.
     A1 PIC X(5).
     A2 PIC 999.
     A3 PIC X(2).
 01 B PIC X(8).
. . .
 MOVE A TO B

qualityStandards.name: HA - internal failure mitigation
qualityStandards.description: Quality rules related to the presence of occurrences of structural coding patterns that are known to cause functional failures

qualityStandards.name: MIPS Reduction - focus on avoiding transaction failure
qualityStandards.description: MIPS Reduction assess the level of resources that are wasted on account of sub-optimal coding regarding Efficiency and Robustness areas. Sub-optimal coding regarding Efficiency cause unnecessary consumption of resources, that will ultimately cause unnecessary consumption of electrical power when applications run in production. Sub-optimal coding regarding Robustness cause unnecessary consumption of resources, when it comes down to application shutdown and restart because it failed or because its integrity was corrupted.
